subject: Re: how to name the letters
msgSnippet: Spelling out words may also create strange yet workable phrases. turned for example: to utter arr and do.
messageBody:
Spelling out words may also create strange yet workable phrases. "turned" for example: "to utter 'arr' and do."

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Scott Ellsworth <scott@...> wrote:
>
> Yes, Tim, I like your ideas here. In fact, my own set of letter names
> mostly uses the Senior abbreviations, though in some cases I diverge
> from that in order to avoid ambiguity: so TOT instead of TO, FEE
> instead of FOR. I thought it made a lot of sense to use the standard
> abbreviations to offer some savings in effort to new learners, but the
> exceptions that I then added in seem to lessen that appeal.
>
>
>
> All the Best,
>
>
>
> Scott
>
>
>
